question: Which country houses the maroon community village "Baracara"?
explanation: Baracara is a maroon community in the East Berbice-Corentyne Region of Guyana, located on the Canje River. The community has also been called New Ground Village or Wel te Vreeden. Baracara is the only maroon village in Guyana. A group of escaped slaves settled in Baracara in the early 19th century and occupied both the east and west banks of the river. The economy of the village is based on subsistence farming and logging.
